title: India returns Chandrayaan-3 propulsion module to Earth orbit
summary: The spacecraft that transported the Chandrayaan-3 lander to the moon has returned to Earth orbit, a demonstration of technologies to support a future Indian lunar sample return mission.

title: SatixFy handed stock exchange delisting warning
summary: SatixFy is the latest space firm to face being kicked off a stock exchange after shares plummeted following a merger with a Special Purpose Acquisition Company (SPAC), a fast-track alternative to traditional initial public offerings of stock.

title: Industry report: Demand for satellites is rising but not skyrocketing
summary: A new report predicts that around 20,000 new satellites will launch by the end of the decade — a more conservative forecast compared to other sky-high projections.

title: York reveals latest commercial space-as-a-service mission
summary: York Space Systems established contact within three hours of the Dec. 1 launch of a commercial space-as-a-service mission for CACI International.

title: What happens in Vega didn’t stay in Vega, as key rocket parts went missing
summary: There's a valuable payload riding on the final Vega rocket launch.

title: The Case of the Missing Vega AVUM Propellant Tanks
summary:
Two of the four tanks necessary to power the fourth stage of the final Vega flight disappeared several months ago, leaving Avio scrambling to find an alternate solution. The Vega AVUM fourth stage stands at 1.74 meters tall with a diameter of 1.9 meters. The stage is equipped with the Ukrainian RD-869 UDMH/NTO liquid-fueled engine. […]
The post The Case of the Missing Vega AVUM Propellant Tanks appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA updating policy for rideshare missions
summary: NASA is developing an updated rideshare policy for science missions that reflects both new launch opportunities as well as challenges faced in accommodating secondary payloads.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy December 3-9, 2023
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of December 3-9, 2023 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]

title: 30 years after its first repair mission, Hubble continues to observe the cosmos
summary: Thirty years ago, on the very early morning of Dec. 2, 1993, the Space Shuttle Endeavour and the STS-61 crew launched on a high-stakes mission to repair the Hubble Space Telescope. 30 years after the successful flight, which enabled Hubble to finally fulfill its promise to revolutionize our view of the Universe, the veteran observatory is still making new discoveries and may get a new lease on life deeper into the 21st century.

title: Hubble glitch renews talk about private servicing mission
summary: A problem with the Hubble Space Telescope has renewed discussion about whether and how NASA might approve a private mission to reboost and potentially repair the spacecraft.
